pageContext.claim: “I don't even discuss it [pardoning Paul Manafort]. I have -- the only one discussing it is you. I haven't discussed it.”
pageContext.analysis: The Washington Post reported Aug. 23, 2018, that "a senior administration official said the president discussed the pros and cons of granting pardons to Manafort and others linked to a probe of his campaign 'a few weeks ago.'" Days after Trump made these remarks on March 8, claiming he had never even discussed the possibility of pardoning Manafort, White House press secretary Sarah Sanders said at a briefing, "He'll make the decision when he’s ready."
